subject: Re: [junit] Database Select query checks!! newbie
msgSnippet: ... only problem with testing queries like this is that your test will be time and database dependent, because data (in this case the number of news beans) may
messageBody:
> (2) Your tests are simple: populate the database with data, write News beans
> that represent that data, assert that getAllNews() answers the same Set (or
> List, if you care about order within the collection) of News beans. Do this
> with as many different datasets as you need to be confident that your method
> works.

only problem with testing queries like this is that your test will be time and
database dependent, because data (in this case the number of news beans)
may change over time, and you will see the red bar even though your method
works fine.
There is a line of thought that all you need to do is make sure your SQL
is valid. beyond that you're testing your database, not your method...

regards,
Nilesh
